io.netty.handler.codec.spdy

Class SpdyOrHttpChooser

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelDuplexHandler
          • io.netty.handler.codec.spdy.SpdyOrHttpChooser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundByteHandler, ChannelOperationHandler, ChannelStateHandler

    public abstract class SpdyOrHttpChooser
extends ChannelDuplexHandler
implements ChannelInboundByteHandler
    ChannelInboundByteHandler which is responsible to setup the ChannelPipeline either for HTTP or SPDY. This offers an easy way for users to support both at the same time while not care to much about the low-level details.

      Add all ChannelHandler's that are needed for HTTP.

      Add all ChannelHandler's that are needed for SPDY with the given version.
      protected abstract ChannelInboundMessageHandler<?> createHttpRequestHandlerForHttp()
      Create the ChannelInboundMessageHandler that is responsible for handling the http requests when the SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol was SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.HTTP_1_0 or SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.HTTP_1_1
      protected ChannelInboundMessageHandler<?> createHttpRequestHandlerForSpdy()
      Create the ChannelInboundMessageHandler that is responsible for handling the http responses when the SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol was SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.SPDY_2 or SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.SPDY_3.

      Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption.
      void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)

    • Method Detail

      • getProtocol

        protected abstract SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol getProtocol(SSLEngine engine)
        Return the SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol for the SSLEngine. If its not known yet implementations MUST return SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.UNKNOWN.

      • newInboundBuffer

        public ByteBuf newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                         throws Exception
        Return the Buf which will be used for inbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext.
        Specified by:
        newInboundBuffer in interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Throws:

      • discardInboundReadBytes

        public void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption. The most common implementation of this method will look like the following: 
             ctx.inboundByteBuffer().discardSomeReadBytes();
        Specified by:
        discardInboundReadBytes in interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • freeInboundBuffer

        public void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                       throws Exception
        Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • inboundBufferUpdated

        public void inboundBufferUpdated(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                          throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelStateHandler
        The inbound buffer of the ChannelHandlerContext was updated with new data. This means something may be ready to get processed by the actual ChannelStateHandler implementation. It's up to the implementation to consume it or keep it in the buffer to wait for more data and consume it later.
        Specified by:
        inboundBufferUpdated in interface ChannelStateHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • addSpdyHandlers

        protected void addSpdyHandlers(ChannelHandlerContext ctx,
                   int version)
        Add all ChannelHandler's that are needed for SPDY with the given version.

      • addHttpHandlers

        protected void addHttpHandlers(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
        Add all ChannelHandler's that are needed for HTTP.

      • createHttpRequestHandlerForHttp

        protected abstract ChannelInboundMessageHandler<?> createHttpRequestHandlerForHttp()
        Create the ChannelInboundMessageHandler that is responsible for handling the http requests when the SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol was SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.HTTP_1_0 or SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.HTTP_1_1

      • createHttpRequestHandlerForSpdy

        protected ChannelInboundMessageHandler<?> createHttpRequestHandlerForSpdy()
        Create the ChannelInboundMessageHandler that is responsible for handling the http responses when the SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol was SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.SPDY_2 or SpdyOrHttpChooser.SelectedProtocol.SPDY_3. Bye default this getMethod will just delecate to createHttpRequestHandlerForHttp(), but sub-classes may override this to change the behaviour.
